node.title: Traditional owners outraged, Bravus pleased, after dismissal of heritage destruction concerns
node.alt: an aerial photo shows a mine site excavation area, with rocks around the perimeter
node.description: A small group of Wangan and Jagalingou people are concerned an ancient stone tool-making site at the Carmichael Mine in Queensland has been lost forever.
node.content:
["Concerns about the destruction of a sacred site at the Carmichael Mine have been dismissed by the Queensland government, pleasing mining company Bravus but outraging some traditional owners\u00a0concerned artefacts have been lost forever.", "After years of controversy, the Central Queensland mine is going to export its first coal by the end of the year.", "The Queensland Department for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Partnerships has dismissed concerns about the destruction of an Indigenous knapping site\u00a0due to insufficient evidence of harm.\u00a0", "Most Wangan and Jagalingou people support the project\u00a0and are working with Bravus \u2014 Adani's Australian arm \u2014 to manage the site's cultural heritage.", "But a small group of traditional owners\u00a0who have been camped at the site for months\u00a0claim an area containing the highest concentration of artefacts on the mining lease has been destroyed.", "", "
Wangan and Jagalingou people say this site at the mine was an ancient knapping site for stone tool-making.\u00a0(Supplied: Nagana Yarrbayn cultural custodians)
", "The group is concerned the area has been excavated without an archaeological dig or adequate consultation.", "Through the Environmental Defender's Office, the group requested the Queensland government investigate and issue a stop work order.", "The Department for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander has been considering the request for the last month.", "
'Avoid public monies being expended'
", "In a letter seen by the ABC from the department's Cultural Heritage Unit, the request for investigation was refused.", "One of the reasons cited in the letter for the decision was to \"avoid public monies being expended on investigations in the absence of information sufficient to found a reasonable basis for suspecting the commission of an offence.\"", "In its letter, the unit said the clearance activities were carried out in accordance with the resolutions passed by Bravus' Cultural Heritage Committee.", "It said the information available is not sufficient to warrant an investigation as there was no evidence of actual harm to Aboriginal cultural heritage.", "", "
A group of Wangan and Jagalingou\u00a0people have been camped near the Carmichael Coal mine.(Supplied:\u00a0Coedie McAvoy)
", "Bravus said the allegations were misleading and made by a small group of people who do not represent the majority of Clermont Belyando \u2014 Wangan and Jagalingou\u00a0\u2014 traditional owners.", "It said the decision confirms the company's Cultural Heritage Committee is ensuring cultural heritage is managed in an appropriate, legal, and respectful way.", "", "
Police have been investigating Bravus' complaints about the camp at the Carmichael Mine.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Coedie McAvoy)
", "Through a statement released by Bravus, Clermont Belyando native title applicants acting coordinator Irene Simpson said the EDO's interference was offensive and paternalistic.", "\"It is important that groups like the EDO and the media acknowledge our views and rights as the traditional custodians of the lands and any decisions that are made respectfully by the majority of the Claim Group,\" Ms Simpson said in the statement.", "", "
Traditional owners camped near the mine have witnessed the clearing of this site, which they say contained hundreds of artefacts.\u00a0(Supplied: Nagana Yarrbayn cultural custodians)
", "Meanwhile, the traditional owners opposed to the mine, known as Nagana Yarrbayn cultural custodians, maintain their people have been strong-armed into working with Bravus.", "\"Adani knew about the significance of this sacred site for years\u00a0but failed to inform Aboriginal people until the last minute\u00a0and pushed on to destroy the site when we spoke up,\" said Wangan and Jagalingou elder Adrian Burragubba.", "While both Bravus and the Wangan and Jagalingou mine opponents have said they were informed of the decision by the Queensland government, the department itself has not responded to requests for comment."]
